args.natural_language_statement: Translate to Lean4 the following theorem and produce only the Lean4 code (end the statement with := by sorry). Include `import Mathlib` at top. Statement: For any types G and H with Group and Fintype instances, if Fintype.card G = 21 and Fintype.card H = 21 and both G and H are nonabelian (¬ CommGroup), then G ≃* H (there exists a MulEquiv between them). Name the theorem `herstein_exercise_2_8_12`.

  (hG : Fintype.card G = 21) (hH : Fintype.card H = 21)
  (nG : ¬ CommGroup G) (nH : ¬ CommGroup H) : MulEquiv G H := by sorry

Statement: For any types G and H with Group and Fintype instances, if Fintype.card G = 21 and Fintype.card H = 21 and both G and H are nonabelian (i.e. ¬ (∀ x y : G, x * y = y * x) and similarly for H), then there exists a MulEquiv between G and H. Name the theorem `herstein_exercise_2_8_12`.

import Mathlib

theorem herstein_exercise_2_8_12 {G H : Type _} [Group G] [Fintype G] [Group H] [Fintype H]
  (hG : Fintype.card G = 21) (hH : Fintype.card H = 21)
  (nG : ¬ (∀ x y : G, x * y = y * x)) (nH : ¬ (∀ x y : H, x * y = y * x)) : MulEquiv G H := by sorry
